page.title: 04EDUCATION - BRANSTONE FARM
page.content: Owned by the Isle of Wight County Council, used for teaching school children about farming, it is in the N.E. corner of our survey area and is 23 acres divided into 8 fields, 7 of planted grass, one an area of wet land kept to encourage wildlife. There are 5 barns and animal sheds, 18 machines - including tractor, ploughs, cultivator, fertiliser, spreader, baler, grass cutter, feed-barrows and hay turner. The farm is not commercially viable. 1 stockman and 1 teacher work the farm. In 1984, 3000 mainland children, all the Island schools and some playgroups visited the farm. The animals kept are dairy cows, breeding pigs and hens. The average annual yield/animal is - cow -5800 pints; sow - 20 piglets; hen - 200 eggs.
